intro: Tabernaemontana acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lanceolate leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Tabernaemontana acuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
